sentences.sContent: She had a bottle in each hand.
sentences.sCn: 她两只手上各拿着一个瓶子。

sentences.sContent: Grill the fish for five minutes on each side.
sentences.sCn: 把鱼的两面各烤上五分钟。

sentences.sContent: Each member of the team is given a particular job to do.
sentences.sCn: 队里的每个成员都有特定的工作要做。

sentences.sContent: We each have our own skills.
sentences.sCn: 我们每个人都有自己的技能。

sentences.sContent: When the children arrive, you give them each a balloon.
sentences.sCn: 孩子们到后，你给他们每人发一个气球。

sentences.sContent: There are four bedrooms, each with its own shower and WC.
sentences.sCn: 有四间卧室，每间都有独立的淋浴器和抽水马桶。

sentences.sContent: The tickets cost £20 each (= each ticket costs £20 ).
You get two cookies each (= every one of you gets two cookies ).
sentences.sCn: 你们每人可以拿两块甜饼干。

sentences.sContent: There are 250 blocks of stone, and each one weighs a ton.
sentences.sCn: 有250块大石头，每块重一吨。

phrases.pCn: 人人，各人，每人，个个，各个
全部，个个；全体，人人，大家都，统统；没有例外

trans.tranOther: every one of two or more things or people, considered separately
